chargeHist.descr: Child Sexual Exploitation - Produce, Perform, etc.
Child Sexual Exploitation - Produce, Perform, etc.

result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher C King was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.  Sentence credit for 3 days were granted.

superMiscConds.notes: Bail applied to Surcharge/Costs.  Paid in full.  Remainder of bail to be refunded to poster.

Register as a sex offender as required by law.
Use of Internet and computer and digital devices be monitored as deemed by Agent.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christopher C King in court with attorney Stephen Michael Govin.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties address the victim impact statement. State makes recommendations.  Attorney Govin makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 
The Court Orders the Following:  Count #1.  

Imposed Sentence of:
8 Years Imprisonment (Credit - 3 days )
3 Years of Initial Confinement
5 Years of Extended Supervision

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Register as a sex offender as required by law. 
Use of internet and compunter and digial devices be monitored as deemed by agent. 
Cost: $268.00 Bail to be applied. 
Child Pornography surcharge 973.042(2): $500.00.  Bail to be applied. 
DNA surcharge: $250.00  Bail to be applied. 
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program
Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
